item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,453
item.content:encoded: These are the key developments from day 1,453 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

item.title: Israel bombs Lebanon-Syria border, kills four people
item.content:encoded: Lebanese authorities say Israeli forces bombed a vehicle near the border, killing at least four people.

item.title: Can the UN Security Council be reformed?
item.content:encoded: The UN secretary-general says the absence of African seats is 'indefensible'.

item.title: Israel kills 11 in Gaza as Trump announces $5bn pledge from Board of Peace
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump says the first meeting of his newly created Board of Peace will take place on Thursday.

item.title: Gaza mother’s grim ordeal: A search for missing son among mutilated bodies
item.content:encoded: Gaza families seek closure as they search for loved ones among bodies returned by Israel under 'ceasefire' deal.

item.title: Is Trumpism losing steam?
item.content:encoded: As Trumpism forces both major US parties to wonder what they stand for, experts weigh in on November election prospects.

item.title: Ukraine’s ex-energy minister arrested while trying to cross border
item.content:encoded: German Galushchenko was detained by Ukraine's anti-corruption bureau while trying to leave the country.

item.title: India rout bitter rivals Pakistan at T20 World Cup
item.content:encoded: India's win against Pakistan takes the defending champions through to the next round of cricket's T20 World Cup.

item.title: Syrian army takes over al-Shaddadi base after US withdrawal
item.content:encoded: The move, in coordination with the US, is the latest implementation of the ceasefire agreement with Kurdish-led forces.

item.title: India hammer Pakistan to qualify for T20 World Cup Super Eights
item.content:encoded: Ishan Kishan defies a tricky Colombo pitch with 77 as India beat Pakistan by 61 runs in Group A of the T20 World Cup.

item.title: US ‘not disputing’ European assessment of Navalny poisoning, Rubio says
item.content:encoded: Secretary of state says Washington will 'not fight' European partners on their findings as UK considers new sanctions.

item.title: Thousands of Western nationals fought Israel’s war on Gaza: What to know
item.content:encoded: Thousands of Western citizens joined the Israeli military in its war on Gaza that killed over 72,000 Palestinians.

item.title: As Sudanese city returns to life after two-year siege, drone threat lingers
item.content:encoded: Markets reopen in Dilling, South Kordofan’s second largest city. Yet residents face persistent aerial attacks.

item.title: Iran seeks to get out of FATF blacklist amid domestic political divisions
item.content:encoded: North Korea and Myanmar are other two countries on global financial blacklist as Tehran promises countermeasures.

item.title: Iran’s Araghchi slams European powers for ‘irrelevance’ in nuclear talks
item.content:encoded: Foreign minister says regional powers have been 'far more effective' than European countries.

item.title: Hasan Piker on influence and journalism in the algorithm age
item.content:encoded: The political streamer discusses bias, bans, wealth, activism and the blurred line between journalism and influencers.

item.title: Filmmaker explains why he backs Francesca Albanese amid pressure to resign
item.content:encoded: Over 100 artists have signed a letter in support of Francesca Albanese who faces calls to step down as UN rapporteur.

item.title: Cricket fans ready for hotly-anticipated India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash
item.content:encoded: Supporters of India and Pakistan have flocked to see the highly-anticipated cricket match between archrivals at the ICC.

item.title: Gaza author and analyst Jehad Abusalim on Trump’s ‘Board of Peace’
item.content:encoded: Gaza author Jehad Abusalim speaks to Marc Lamont Hill on Trump’s Board of Peace and the enclave's future.

item.title: Europeans say Russia poisoned dissident Alexey Navalny with dart frog toxin
item.content:encoded: Five European countries say lab tests conclude that Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny was killed in 2024.

item.title: Israel approves proposal to register West Bank lands as ‘state property’
item.content:encoded: Proposal submitted by far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich and others, public broadcaster Kan reports.

item.title: Gaza’s Nasser Hospital slams MSF’s ‘unsubstantiated’ armed men allegation
item.content:encoded: Hospital says MSF issued statements that 'misrepresent facts, mirror narratives historically used to justify' attacks.

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu align on Iran pressure but split on endgame
item.content:encoded: Trump, Netanyahu agree to sanction Iranian oil; analysts say Israel is pushing for war to cover West Bank annexation.

item.title: How the Epstein files exposed victims but protected the powerful
item.content:encoded: The release of the Epstein files was supposed to expose a sex trafficking ring. Instead, they exposed the victims.

item.title: From the Balkans with Guns
item.content:encoded: Weapons from the Balkans are fuelling violence on the streets of Sweden. People & Power follows their trail.
